title: Shrimp fried in beer batter served with tartar sauce and capers.

ingredients: About 150 ml of light chilled beer
125 g flour + 3 extra tablespoons to coat the prawns
300 grams of raw shrimp, peeled, with tail
tatar-sauce: Half a bunch of dill, chopped
steps: Gradually mix beer with flour previously mixed with baking powder, hot bell pepper and salt. Add enough beer to get the right consistency of batter (it should be thick).

Heat the oil to a depth of at least 5 cm, coat the shrimp in flour and dip them in the batter, holding them by the tail. Scrape off the excess batter and dip into the hot oil. Fry 4 shrimp in smaller pots at a time, so that the oil temperature does not drop too low and the batter does not soak up too much fat. Fry the shrimp for about 2 minutes until golden brown.
Drain on paper towel and season with salt if desired. Serve with lemon pieces and tartar sauce in a separate bowl. Just stir the sauce ingredients together.
suggestions: * You can use carbonated mineral water instead of beer.

ingredients: 2 teaspoons of garam masala spice mix.
4 cloves of garlic, finely grated or pressed
1 tsp honey (optional, not found in the original) or sugar
A few drops of red food colouring (optional)
steps: Remove skin from shanks (discard skins will not be needed in this recipe). Pat the drumsticks dry with a paper towel, season with salt, place them in a large plastic or glass bowl, and coat with the garam masala spice mixture, hot and sweet paprika. Add olive oil or oil and use your hands to thoroughly grease the chicken.

Then add ginger, garlic, onion, honey, tomato paste, lemon juice and rub the chicken again. Add natural yogurt and food coloring if using, mix everything gently and set aside to marinate (overnight in the refrigerator or at least 3 hours on the stove top).

Remove the chicken thighs from the marinade (do not clean off the marinade), discard the remaining marinade accumulated at the bottom of the bowl, you won't need it anymore. Place the chicken on the grill and grill for 60 minutes on a covered garden grill, preferably using the indirect method with the coals spread over the sides of the grill - as in the photo below (under the chicken there is a tray with water into which the fat drips), or bake in an oven preheated to 200 degrees also for 60 minutes, turning the drumsticks from time to time. After baking, the meat should come away nicely from the bone. Serve with thick natural yogurt.
suggestions: natural yoghurt / lettuce / couscous / grilled zucchini / salad with grilled zucchini and feta

title: Chicken Saltimbocca.
description: Chicken fillets fried with sage and Parma ham with wine-butter sauce and cherry tomatoes. In the traditional version, Saltimbocca is prepared with veal schnitzels and no tomatoes.
steps: Cut the chicken lengthwise into 2 thinner fillets, additionally smash the thickest parts with a pestle so as to obtain meat of the same thickness. Season with salt and pepper, brush with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and leave to marinate for at least half an hour.
Lay the fillets on a board, place the sage leaves on top. Cover with a slice of Parma ham or cut the ham slices lengthwise in half and wrap the resulting strips around the fillets.

Heat a frying pan, pour in 3 tablespoons of olive oil and when hot place the fillets sage side down. Fry over medium heat for about 3 minutes, then flip to the other side and repeat frying for about 3 minutes.

Set the fried meat aside on a plate and cover with foil or a bowl. Pour the wine into the pan after the chicken, add honey and cook over high heat for about 3 minutes until reduced by half, pour in the broth and again cook over high heat for 3 minutes.

Add the halved cherry tomatoes and cook, stirring every now and then, for about 2 to 3 minutes until softened. Add 2 tablespoons of butter, melt and stir, put the fillets back in and heat through gently. Sprinkle with a slice of lemon, remove from heat.
suggestions: e.g. pasta, potatoes, risotto, millet groats, quinoa, couscous

title: Stir-fry with beef and broccoli
description: Chinese wok dish with thinly sliced beef and broccoli in a thick sauce, served with rice.
sauce: 2 pinches of white pepper (or black pepper)
steps: Put the beef in the freezer beforehand for about half an hour (firmly cooled will cut better)
Prepare the side dishes: cook the rice and roast the sesame seeds in a dry pan. Wash the broccoli and cut into small florets.
Peel and finely grate the ginger and garlic. Mix in a bowl with the remaining sauce ingredients, set aside.

Heat a wok or deep skillet, add 1/2 tablespoon oil. Add the broccoli, season with a pinch of salt and stir-fry for 1 - 2 minutes. Then add a few tablespoons of water every now and then and cook the broccoli this way for about 7 minutes. Remove from the pan and set aside on a plate.
Remove the meat from the freezer and cut it into thin strips
In the same pan, add a tablespoon of oil. When it is hot, put in the meat and fry it for 1 minute on high heat. Turn over to the other side and repeat the frying.
Pour in the sauce and bring to a boil. Boil for 2 to 3 minutes, add broccoli and mix. Serve with cooked rice sprinkled with sesame seeds.
